definitions.definition: An imitation, usually of lesser quality.
A practice exam set by an educating institution to prepare students for an important exam.
definitions.example: He got a B in his History mock, but improved to an A in the exam.

definitions.definition: To create an artistic representation of.
To make fun of by mimicking, to taunt.
To tantalise, and disappoint the hopes of.
To create a mockup or prototype of.
definitions.example: What's the best way to mock a database layer?
